title: Doppler - moving speaker and 3 observers at X Y

content.question:
A loudspeaker moving to the right with a speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is emitting sound in both the forward and backward directions, as shown in the figure. Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is located to the left of the speaker, point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is located to the right of the speaker, and the sound emitted by the speaker has a rest frequency of <math alttext="f sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math>. Three observers, not shown in the figure, have the following positions and velocities.

Observer <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is at Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and running to the right at speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>.

Observer <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is at Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and running to the right at speed <math alttext="2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math>.

Observer <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is at Point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and running to the left at speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>.
Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="f sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and the frequencies <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="f sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> heard by observers <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="f sub 2, end sub, is greater than, open parenthesis, f sub 1, end sub, equals, f sub 3, end sub, close parenthesis, which is greater than, f sub R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub 3, end sub, is greater than, f sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, open parenthesis, f sub 1, end sub, equals, f sub R, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub 3, end sub, is greater than, f sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, f sub 1, end sub, which is greater than f sub R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub 3, end sub, is greater than, f sub R, end sub, which is greater than, open parenthesis, f sub 1, end sub, equals, f sub 2, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f sub 3, end sub, is greater than, f sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, open parenthesis, f sub 1, end sub, equals, f sub R, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
